messages.original: A single HIMARS GMLRS rocket was shot down while on its way to Donetsk city. The rocket was launched from near Kramatorsk
A single HIMARS GMLRS rocket was shot down while on its way to Donetsk city. The rocket was launched from near Kramatorsk

In the Kupyansk direction, Russian forces broke through Ukrainian positions east of the Oskil River and entered the village of Petropavlivka.
Russian forces from the 1st Tank Regiment spearheaded an attack west down the northern bank of the Hnylytsya River for ~3.5km, reaching and entering the southeasternmost houses of Petropavlivka. However, its unclear if they were able to capture any positions here. Soldiers from Azov, who were already stationed in the area, subsequently launched a counterattack on the approaches to Petropavlivka, which was reportedly repelled. 
Further north, additional Russian forces began clearing  a series of trench strongpoints on the tactical heights, while other forces pushed in from the heights to the north, enveloping any remaining Ukrainian forces within this salient. 
Another push was made to the northwest, where Russian forces broke through to the northern bank of the reservoir east of Petropavlivka, and established control over a large trench line further east.
It's unclear if any Ukrainian redeployments from here to Dobropillya took place, and the main reason for this sudden advance is likely a lack of supplies running over the Oskil River.
+ ~20.80km¬≤ in favour of Russia.

Early this morning, 10+ Ukrainian UAVs attacked the Syzran Oil Refinery in Samara Oblast, around 800km away from Ukraine. 
At least five impacts were recorded, resulting in large fires breaking out that are still burning. Flights in and out of Samara Airport were temporarily suspended, and internet was shut off in some parts of the region. 
Coordinates: 53.08067, 48.39310

New footage showing 4 consecutive Russian Geran-2 drone strikes on a Ukrainian command post which was under construction, near the village of Byryne, Chernihiv Oblast.
Coordinates: 52.10138, 33.37555

Last night, another large-scale Russian Geran-2 drone attack was carried out on the Dobropillya area of Donetsk Oblast.
At least 10 impacts were recorded in and around Dobropillya, Svyatohorivka and Bilozerske, likely targeting Ukrainian units related to containing and counterattacking the breakthrough at Zolotyi Kolodyaz.

 Israeli forces are carrying out expansion works on Al-Marj hill, located on the outskirts of Wadi Hunin near Merka in southern Lebanon.
@wfwitness

North of Zolotyi Kolodyaz, these small trench systems here, according to the Ukrainians, are reinforced with concrete.
They say, it already takes dozens of drone drops and FPV attacks to force them out of a wood dugout. If they were to gain a foothold in these concrete trenches, it will be impossible to knock them out. That's the importance of the New Donbas Line. It was built with solutions to modern problems in mind.

North of Zolotyi Kolodyaz, these small trench systems here, according to the Ukrainians, are reinforced with concrete. They say, it already takes dozens of drone drops and FPV attacks to force them out of a wood dugout. If they were to gain a foothold in these‚Ä¶

While the main line has been breached, those types of isolated strongpoints have been formidable in the past, but of course only if they are properly manned. These trenches are probably better manned than most places considering the massive reinforcements brought in.
A Shahid hit a petrol station not far from me, this was frequented by the Ukrainian military.

In the Borova direction, Russian forces advanced and captured the village of Zelenyi Hai.
Russian forces advanced south from the tactical heights to the north, and entered the agricultural buildings on the northern outskirts of Zelenyi Hai. The main attack likely came from the east, with Russian forces pushing along the northern bank of a small river, before entering and clearing the residential part of the settlement. 
Ukrainian forces largely withdrew to the line of fortifications south and west of Zelenyi Hai, although Russian forces have already crossed the river and captured a small forest south of the village.
+ ~3.35km¬≤ in favour of Russia.
Possible KAB glide-bomb launches to Kharkiv City.
Possible KAB glide-bomb launches to Kharkiv City.
The KABs impacted the Kozacha Lopan area of Kharkiv Oblast, near the international border.

On August 14, Ukrainian UAVs from the Special Operations Forces of the AFU attacked the Olya Port (Astrakhan Oblast) in the Caspian Sea.
As a result, the vessel "Port Olya 4" was hit and is now sinking. The Ukrainian General Staff claimed that it held components for Geran-2/3 drones as well as ammunition from Iran.
